meanings.definition: To make a low, guttural sound like a frog.
meanings.sent1: The frog troaks loudly in the pond.
meanings.sent2: I heard the frogs troaking all night long.
meanings.sent3: The frog troaks so much, it should join a choir!
meanings.sent4: His voice troaks like a frog in the early morning.
meanings.sent5: The sound of troaking frogs filled the swamp with music.

meanings.sent1: The troaks of the frogs echoed through the forest.
meanings.sent2: I couldn't sleep because of the loud troaks outside.
meanings.sent3: The troaks of the frogs sounded like a broken trumpet.
meanings.sent4: The troaks of the frogs were a symphony of nature.
meanings.sent5: The sudden troak startled me in the quiet night.

meanings.definition: To speak in a hoarse or croaking voice.
meanings.sent1: He troaks when he has a sore throat.
meanings.sent2: The old man troaks when he tries to talk.
meanings.sent3: She troaks like a frog when she's sick.
meanings.sent4: His voice troaks with emotion during the speech.
meanings.sent5: The troaking voice added a mysterious tone to the story.
